title.narrative: Life saving assistance to Venezuelan migrants in vulnerable situations and host communities

description.narrative: The main objective of this project is to bring timely humanitarian assistance to the most vulnerable Venezuelan migrants and asylum-seekers in the most affected host communities in six of the Latin America and the Caribbean countries (Brazil, Colombia, Equateur, Guyana, Peru, Trinidad and Tobago). With this CERF allocation, IOM will track 32,908 Venezuelan through DTM and will provide shelter/accomodation to 3,426 others. The project will last six months and will benefit 46,516 people including 21,272 women and 8,051 children.

humanitarian-scope.narrative: Venezuela Regional Refugee and Migration Crisis DISPLACEMENT 2018

description.narrative: Disbursement to CERF Project Life saving assistance to Venezuelan migrants in vulnerable situations and host communities

title.narrative: RESIDENT / HUMANITARIAN COORDINATOR REPORT ON THE USE OF CERF FUNDS Venezuela Regional Refugee and Migration Crisis RAPID RESPONSE DISPLACEMENT 2018

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.

description.narrative: 1,000 Venezuelan women, men, girls and boys receive emergency assistance and referral services through Migrant Support Center in Tumbes
Description
Designing and distributing information materiales on emergency assistance services and protection mechanism available
Number of GoP agencies and local NGOs to which migrants in need of emergency assistance will be refered by the MSC
Number of Venezuelan nationals provided with life saving information and emergency assistance through Tumbes MSC (disaggregated by sex and age)
Referral of migrants to local providers of emergency assistance according to pre-established service agreements.
Training of MSC staff in emergency assistance and referral protocols following IASC GBV and PSEA Guidelines.
1,300 Venezuelan nationals in areas with high concentration of migrants as well as at risk of explotation and abuse, receive documentation and regularization assistance.
Description
Designing of information instruments integrating a gender age perspective
Documentation, orientation, information sharing and training to support regularization and registration activities
Identification of priority regions according to risk and vulnerability profiles
Number of migrants including Guyanese who lived in Venezuela provided with information on documentation and regularization mechanisms (dissagregated by sex, age and municipality)
Number of migrants resource centres where information on documentation and regularization is available for Venezuelan nationals
1,500 Venezuelan nationals in high risk spots for trafficking, smuggling and other forms of explotation and abuse receive life saving information

Number of Venezuelan migrants directly provided with information on threats of trafficking, smuggling and other forms of explotation and abuse and avaialable assistance mechanisms (dissagregated by sex, age and municipality)
Number of municipalities with high risk spots where life saving information is disseminated
1,500 Venezuelan nationals profiled in the Binational Border Center (CEBAF) through DTM to identify women, men, girls and boys who need emergency assistance and protection
Number of DTM interviews conducted
Number of Goverment of Peru''s institutions that receive the information on needs of emergency assistance and protection.

1,800 Venezuelan Migrants in vulnerable situations provided with registration assistance and referral through government officials and implementing partners trained in emergency response in CCCM, PSEA and protection incident management, including GBV incidents.
Description
Monitor with GoT&T protocol application in critical service and information points
Number of government officials and implementing partners'' staff trained in emergency response in CCCM, PSEA and protection incident management, including GBV incidents
Number of vulnerable migrants assisted (identification and referral) (disaggregated by sex and age)
Provision of technical assistance to the GoT&T to adjust existing emergency assistance and referral protocols as per protection standards
Training of first line officials and implementing partners'' staff on the updated protocol
2,250 Venezuelan migrants in high vulnerability conditions have access to temporary accommodation responding to gender and age specific needs.
Number of migrants provided with a temporary accommodation subsidy (disaggregated by sex and age)
2,250 entries in the Registro Administrativo de Migrantes Venezolanos (RAMV) screened for individual cases that require the activation of emergency assistance and protection mechanisms.
Number of RAMV registration centers in critical entry and receiving areas supported during the registration process
Percentage of RAMV entries screened for identification of cases of emergency assistance and protection.

2,500 Venezuelan nationals and returning Guyanese at bordering communities and critical transit points profiled through DTM to identify women, men, girls and boys who need emergency assistance and protection
Number of DTM interviews conducted (dissagregated by Region).

Number of Government of Guyana''s institutions receive information on number of Venezuela migrants and Guyanese who lived in Venezuela and returned to Guyana and in need of emergency assistance and protection.
Number of regions where DTM is implemented.
2,800 Venezuelan nationales and Guyanese who returned from Venezuela to Guyana in high vulnerability conditions have access to non-food items responding to gender specific needs.
Number of existing facilities adequated to provide temporary accommodation to Venezuelan migrants in transit
Number of persons receiving essential NFIs (dissagregated by sex, age and municipality)
3,500 Venezuelan nationals in the border with Colombia, Quito, Guayaquil, Cuenca y Manta profiled through DTM to identify women, men, girls and boys who need emergency assistance and protection
Number of DTM interviews conducted (dissagregated by municipality).
Number of Government of Ecuador''s institutions that receive the information on needs of emergency assistance and protection.
Number of municipalities where DTM is implemented.
3,852 Venezuelan households in critical receiving municipalities profiled through DTM to identify women, men, girls and boys who need emergency assistance and protection
Number of DTM household interviews conducted (dissagregated by municipality).
Number of Government of Colombia''s institutions that receive the information on needs of emergency assistance and protection.
Number of municipalities where DTM is implemented.
4,000 Venezuelan nationals and returning Trinidadians in critical receiving municipalities profiled through DTM to identify women, men, girls and boys who need emergency assistance and protection
Number of DTM interviews conducted (dissagregated by location).

Number of Government of Trinidad and Tobago''s institutions receive information on number of Venezuela migrants and Trinidadians who lived in Venezuela and returned to Trinidad and in need of emergency assistance and protection.
Number of locations where DTM is implemented.
4,700 Venezuelan women, men, girls and boys receive life saving emergency assistance, including psychosocial emergency support, through the Migrant Support Centers
Number of Venezuelan persons who receive emergency assistance in MSCs (disagreagated by sex and age)
Number of regions where Venezuelan nationals have access to MSCs services
5,580 Venezuelan nationals in vulnerable situations are provided with non-food items responding to gender specific needs.
Number of municipalities where NFIs are distributed
Number of persons receiving essential NFIs (dissagregated by sex, age and municipality)
550 Venezuelan nationals who arrive through critical entry points are protected during movement operations inside the Colombian national territory.
Completion of medical screenings to ensure that passengers are fit to travel
Conducting phone calls to follow-up reception assistance upon arrival.
Description
Identification of migrants in most need of protection through transportation assistance.
Number of Venezuelan nationals who receive transportation assistance (disaggregated by sex and age)
Percentage of Venezuelan nationals assisted with transportation who are followed-up after arrival.
Processing of "Willingness to Travel" Consent Forms and distribution of travel extipends
Securing permissions and clearances with appropriate government agencies
576 Venezuelan migrants in high vulnerability conditions receive shelter assistance in border municipalities responding to gender and age specific needs.
Number of municipalities where shelter assistance is provided
Number of persons receiving shelter assistance (dissagregated by sex, age and municipality)
6,000 Venezuelan nationals in Roraima and other border and critical transit points profiled through DTM to identify women, men, girls and boys who need emergency assistance and protection
Number of DTM interviews conducted (dissagregated by municipality).
Number of Goverment of Brazil''s institutions that receive the information on needs of emergency assistance and protection.
Number of municipalities where DTM is implemented.
6,000 Venezuelan women, men, girls and boys receive emergency assistance and referral services through Migrant Support Centers in Rumichaca area and related administrave zone.
Number of Venezuelan persons who receive emergency assistance in MSCs (disagreagated by sex and age)
Number of municipalities where Venezuelan nationals have access to MSCs services
600 Venezuelan migrants in high vulnerability conditions have access to temporary accommodation responding to gender and age specific needs.
Number of existing facilities adequated to provide temporary accommodation to Venezuelan migrants in transit

Number of migrants provided with a accommodation subsidy (disaggregated by sex and age)

7,500 Venezuelan women, men, girls and boys provided with life-saving information on risks and emergency assistance services in Trafficking of Persons (ToP), smuggling, Gender Based Violence (GBV) and other forms of explotation and abuse
Number of MSC staff and first line GoE officials training on emergency to victims of ToP, GBV and other forms of exploitation and abuse
Number of Venezuelan women, men, girls and boys who receive life-saving information on ToP, smuggling, GBV and other forms of explotation and abuse
8,300 Venezuelan nationals receive life saving information and assistance regarding documentation and regularization processes.
Number of migrants provided with information on documentation and regularization mechanisms (dissagregated by sex, age and municipality)
